channel.title: react on Aaron King
channel.description: Recent content in react on Aaron King

item.title: AO Archive: Migrating an Ejected CRA to TypeScript
item.description: https://spin.atomicobject.com/2018/07/04/migrating-cra-typescript/ This is a blog post I wrote while working at Atomic Object. To be honest, I’m not positive how relevant it is today, given that Create React App has evolved so much and TypeScript has become so much more popular (which is a great thing!)

item.title: AO Archive: Rendering Legacy Pages inside React
item.description: https://spin.atomicobject.com/2019/07/19/legacy-pages-react-component/ This is a blog post I wrote while working at Atomic Object. It explains a strategy for slowly migrating an application’s frontend from Ruby on Rails to React. I wrote the post shortly after implementing the idea for the first time, and good news â€“ the web app is still successfully using the LegacyPage and LegacyView components! One known caveat is that things can get a little hairy when you use the back button if the legacy pages post forms.
